sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: More European countries have followed the US's lead and suspended their funding of the UN Relief and Works Agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: While thousands of Palestinians flee from fighting and bombing in Qarnunis towards Rafah on the border with Egypt, the winter rainfall means they encounter harsh conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A man was cleared of all charges after 33 years in prison for a triple homicide he did not commit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: More countries suspended their funding of the UN Relief and Works Agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On Saturday, Britain, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Finland join the USA, Australia and Canada.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The funding is suspended until the investigation as to whether UNRWA workers assisted Hamas on the 7th of October concludes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Although we've already suspended any additional allocations to UNRWA, we'll certainly consider additional, depending on the investigation, whether that requires any additional changes in the way we support UNRWA going forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the secretary general of the Palestine Liberation Organization, Hussein al-Sheikh, called on the countries to reverse their decision, saying it posed great political and humanitarian relief risks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Earlier this week, it was announced that the agency had fired at least 12 workers suspected in assisting Hamas to prepare the October 7th attack on Israel. UNRWA chief Philippe Lazzarini said if suspects were found guilty they'd be subject to criminal prosecution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Human rights activists claim that this is the biggest judicial error in Italian history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On Saturday the Court of Appeal in Rome fully acquitted Beniamino Zuncherdu, who had spent almost 33 years in prison. Zuncherdu was blamed for a triple homicide near Cagliari in 1991. He was arrested, and a witness, the fourth victim who survived the attack despite wounds, pointed at him. Based largely on this testimony, Zuncherdu was sentenced to life in June 1992.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He has repeatedly insisted he is innocent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In 2022 came a turning point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The witness who had accused Zuncherdu admitted he had never seen his face.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He claimed police had twisted his words. In November last year, the court suspended Zuncherdu's sentence, and on Saturday, the justice ultimately pronounced that he spent nearly 33 years in prison for nothing. It is not clear as to whether Zuncherdu will receive any compensation for being falsely convicted and imprisoned. While thousands of Palestinians flee from fighting and

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: bombing in Qarnunis towards Rafah on the border with Egypt, they encounter harsh conditions. A winter rainfall floods the entire city, falling on numerous camps for displaced people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Qarnunis, Israeli forces turn up the pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Palestinian side claims the IDF bombed anything in front of them, including close hits near the Nasser Hospital, the largest that remained operational in the Strip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some places report that 95% of the hospital staff have fled to Rafa on Saturday Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu called Hamas new Nazis he dismissed claims of genocide heard at the International Court of Justice as ridiculous during his video address on Saturday Netanyahu showed Hitler's mind camp in Arabic he claimed the book was discovered by Israeli forces in Gaza. Gaza's health ministry reported on Saturday that 174 Palestinians were killed and 310 wounded in 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Something's on fire. We're not quite sure what it is.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A massive fire broke out in Liverpool on Saturday, with huge plumes of smoke visible throughout the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A dozen engines and more than 50 firefighters arrived to extinguish a burning four-storey building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: City's authorities declared the fire a major incident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Citizens from nearby houses were ordered to evacuate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Others were cordoned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Is he blissfully unaware?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I don't know where I found him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There were no reports of any casualties and the cause has not yet been determined.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The annual Venice Carnival got underway on Saturday and foggy weather didn't do

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: much to dampen spirits. This year, the carnival is dedicated to explorer Marco Polo, probably the most famous Phoenician who ever lived and the inventor of the word million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: 2024 marks 700 years since his death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: His book, Of the Marvels of the World, describes how Europeans perceived the rest of the world during medieval times.
